content.raw:
Thinking a bit more about this, it looks like `LogPlay` has currently 2 roles:

1. Listen to events coming from UI elements and forward them to `gziface`
1. Update other UI elements accordingly

The original idea of this issue was to have an UI independent interface to the playback. After looking closer into the code, I believe this is already covered by `logPlayChanged` events sent to `gziface`. I'm leaning towards leaving `GZ3D.LogPlay` inside `GZ3D.Gui` and other non-jQuery UIs can talk directly to `gziface`.
